fields.description:
In Global expiry settings, When you select what to expire, choosing one of the two available options, actually saves the other option.
If you choose: *Build and release artifacts only* and +Save+, the value that gets saved reflects as *Build and deployment result logs only* and vice-versa

Screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Global Expiry settings are interchanged

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Configuring+system+properties
{quote}
Bamboo on UNIX-based operating systems (such as Solaris, Linux or Mac OS X) can be started by using the setenv.sh script.

Bamboo on Windows-based operating systems can be started by running the setenv.bat file from the command line (which is the same as running the 'Start in Console' option from the Windows Start menu) or as a Windows Service.
{quote}

Bamboo can't be started with setenv file. This mistake started on Bamboo 5.3 documentation

Bamboo 5.2 documentation before the changes is correct https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO052/Configuring+system+properties
fields.summary: Fix Configuring system properties documentation

fields.description:
JIRA has the ability to create triggers to transition issues on closing crucible code reviews etc.
It would be great if JIRA could allow the same facility for setting up triggers when bamboo project is deployed to a particular environment or all environments.
fields.summary: transition trigger on deployemnt

fields.description:
For Bamboo CAPTHA integration, Bamboo depends on records from the {{auth_attempt_info}} table. Bamboo does not read the Crowd {{invalidPasswordAttempts}} attribute.

To causes an issue if the user wants to reset the invalid password attempts through Crowd.

One of the potential benefits of synching this information would be prompting the user to enter CAPTCHA if he/she has breached the invalid login limit even though in other application.
fields.summary: Synchronize Crowd invalidPasswordAttempts and Bamboo auth_attemp_info

fields.description:
Every day I go to the releases page of bamboo and take a note of the issues related to each release and log them when they get deployed to production.

It's a manual process using bamboo and google drive.

Could this be automated?
fields.summary: Provide a list of issues, matching releases and their deploy status

fields.description:
We currently have issue where many teams leave the 'plan branching' feature enabled after disabling all plan branches and master branch of a build plan. It appears as everything is disable (i.e. project is done, no work is being done). However, as an administrator who peruses the log files, we start seeing issues when customer removes access to repository/etc down the line. 

It takes a decent amount of time to actively manage to make sure our error log is actual errors. Basically, this fills the error log with noise, and no signal. It would be nice if there was a 'Disable Build Plan & Branching' that would do all of this for us. 

Alternatively, even a quick way to filter the error log and even better for 'quick actions' next to errors for re-saving repository config or disabling branching, etc.
fields.summary: Disable entire build

fields.description:
Competitors like Jenkins and TeamCity both have ways to trigger builds based off URL invocations (TeamCity is of course geared towards Artifactory) , Bamboo is limited to triggering builds of the following types only:
* Git
* CVS
* Mercurial
* Perforce

Please add build trigger support for URL invocations. 

Example:
[Jenkins URLTrigger Plugin|https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/URLTrigger+Plugin]
fields.summary: URL build trigger

fields.description:
It would be nice to have the ability to clean up the build working directory similar to the Expiry configuration. The Expiry tool provides the ability to remove all build results data (including artifacts and build logs), deployment results and release artifacts, and specify the age (days, weeks or months) they must reach before they get removed. However this doesn't cover the build working directory.

There should be a way to clean up older working directories and not only the current ones. The _"Clean working directory after each build"_ option inside the Job configuration area under the {{Miscellaneous}} tab doesn't help, in this case, because the build time increase is not something scalable in a Continuous Integration build.

For example, if we have a Plan running each hour, the _"Clean working directory after each build"_ option means all the artifacts would need to be downloaded again. It would be good to have a feature that provides such flexibility just like the Global Expiry.
fields.summary: Clean up build working directory similar to the expiry configuration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Bamboo doesn't expire inactive plan braches that didn't run builds.

h3. Environment
* Bamboo version: 5.9.7 and 5.9.10
* Java Version: OpenJDK 1.8 (-XX:MaxPermSize=256m -Xms6g -Xmx6g)
* OS: Linux (2.6.32-573.12.1.el6.x86_64)
* Database: MySQL

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Plan inside Bamboo whose source repository has branches.
# Configure the *Automatic branch management* to delete plan branches after a period of inactivity.
# Create a plan branch through {{Plan configuration >> Branches}} using one of the following options:
#* Configure *Automatic branch management* inside the {{Plan configuration >> Branches}} page to create new plan branches when new branches are detected in the primary source repository.
#* Create a plan branch using the {{create plan branch}} button inside {{Plan configuration >> Branches}}.
# Wait till next time the expiry process is triggered.

h3. Expected Results
The branch should be deleted based on the period of inactivity set in the *Automatic branch management*.

h3. Actual Results
The branch is not deleted and the following messages can be seen in the {{<bamboo-installation-directory>/logs/catalina.out}} file when DEBUG for the *com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.branch* class is enabled:
{noformat}
2016-03-07 03:03:44,809 INFO [scheduler_Worker-1] [BranchExpiryJob] 0 - Branches - Continuous Branches - pds-trytry branch has been removed from the VCS repo. Expiration will be based on stored data about latest commit (inactivity cleanup).
2016-03-07 03:03:44,809 DEBUG [scheduler_Worker-1] [BranchExpiryJob] No existing commit information: using last build date
2016-03-07 03:03:44,809 DEBUG [scheduler_Worker-1] [BranchExpiryJob] No build results: using plan creation date
2016-03-07 03:03:44,809 WARN [scheduler_Worker-1] [BranchExpiryJob] Plan Branch BRANCH-CB1315 does not provide any meaningful date to base expiration on
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
# Manually delete the unused branch.
# Ensure that at least one build is executed when a new plan branch is created. Read more about [Triggering builds|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Triggering+builds] at our official documentation.
fields.summary: Bamboo doesn't expire inactive plan braches that didn't run builds

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=289276984#ConfiguringBambootosendSMTPEmail-ConfiguringemailnotificationsforGmail

The documentation describes that to get Bamboo working with Gmail you need to copy javax.mail-X.X.X.jar and edit server.xml.

Is this really still needed for recent Bamboo versions?
Configuring Gmail through the Administration » Mail Server page has been working for me for quite some time now:
{noformat}
Name = Bamboo
From address = my_gmail_username@gmail.com
Subject prefix = [Bamboo]
Email settings = SMTP
SMTP server = smtp.gmail.com
SMTP port = 587
Username = my_gmail_username - Password = supersecret
Use TLS = checked
{noformat}

Related documentation request: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-17220
fields.summary: "Configuring email notifications for Gmail" documentation unnecessary complicated
Allow agents to share common workspace

fields.description:
h2.Summary

When '/' is used in artifact name (under Artifact Definitions), Bamboo interprets the first '/' as '%2f'. This causes a malformed URL and when user clicks on the artifact to download it later, it returns error.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Create a plan 
# Navigate to the Artifacts Definition
# For artifact name, use 'target/rscriptsskjar/r-scripts-sk-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar' as name.
# Now build the plan and wait for the artifact to be generated.
# Once the artifact is completed, click on it to download it. It will return error 404.

h2.Expected Result
URL of the artifact should point to {{https://<INSTANCE_URL>.atlassian.net/builds/browse/<BUILD>/artifact/shared/targetrscriptsskjar/r-scripts-sk-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar}} .

h2.Current Result
URL of the artifact is pointing to {{https://<INSTANCE_URL>.atlassian.net/builds/browse/<BUILD>/artifact/shared/target%2Frscriptsskjar/r-scripts-sk-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar}} . The first '/' is replaced with '%2fF' causing a malformed URL that returns error 404 when user click on it to download the artifact.

h2.Workaround
Use a name that doesn't contain special characters.
fields.summary: Bamboo interprets '/' as '%2F' when used in artifacts names

fields.description:
h2.Summary
Attempting to load the OAuth Access Token page from User Profile will return NullPointerException for Generic Application Link

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Create an OAuth Generic Application Link in Bamboo
# Configure Incoming Authentication OAuth setting without description
# Create a user access token with the generic application
# Access the user OAuth Access Token page, e.g.: https://<INSTANCE_NAME>.atlassian.net/builds/plugins/servlet/oauth/users/access-tokens.

h2.Expected Results

fields.description:
We encountered an issue where some Checkout Default Repository tasks were failing with the Mercurial error: 

abort: abandoned transaction found!

In the error in the build log, it says to run hg recover, but when this is run in the appropriate cache folder, it responds with "no interrupted transaction avalaible".

We then noticed in the build logs that the specified Agent was using another Agent's Working Build Directory. So we think that they may have been stepping on each other's toes somehow, causing the error.

Once we corrected the configuration, we stopped experiencing the error.

The expanded text from the original error in the build log on Agent03, anonymised:

{noformat}
17-Mar-2016 16:33:19	Error occurred while running Task 'Checkout Default Repository(1)' of type com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.vcs:task.vcs.checkout.
17-Mar-2016 16:33:19	java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.hg.HgCommandException: command 'C:\Program Files\TortoiseHG\hg.exe' pull --rev {rev number} --config {config switches} -o BatchMode=yes' https://{user+pass}@{servername+repo location} failed. Working directory was `{drive}:\Bamboo\Agent01\build-dir\_hg-repositories-cache\{cache directory}'. stderr: abort: abandoned transaction found!
17-Mar-2016 16:33:19	(run 'hg recover' to clean up transaction)
{noformat}

Examining the logs further it appears that the same cache directory was being referenced in the error across the agents.

I posted this info to the Mercurial mailing list and someone recommended I file a bug report.
fields.summary: Mercurial Abandoned Transaction Error caused by incorrect Working Build Directory configuration on Bamboo agents

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When selecting *Detach container* in the Docker task, the container is still terminated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure docker task like normal, selecting _Detach container_
# Run {{while true; do docker ps; done}} via command line
# Run build
(i) Notice Bamboo still terminates the container

h3. Expected Results
Container should be left running in the background as when running {{docker run -d}} 

h3. Actual Results
Container is terminated

h3.Workaround
# Configure command or script task to run the container detached
Info: [Docker run reference|https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/run/#detached-d]
fields.summary: Docker Task "Detach container" still terminates container

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Build plans in Bamboo allows us to create branch plans within to branches in repository from the main branch associated with the main plan.

Whenever we create a Branch Plan in Bamboo, this plan's repository setting can be:
# Override the plan's default repository and use it's own repository
# Don't override and use the default repository.

The current behavior when using option 2 is that all configuration is reused, including the repository branch configuration. The ultimate result is that the branch associated with the _branch plan_ is not used, but the one defined in the _main plan_ and the branch plan ends up behaving just like the parent. The branch associated with the branch plan is ignored.

Regarding this configuration:
# It's not clear in [the documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/using-plan-branches-289276872.html] that the branch plan will use the branch from the main plan
# [This documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/using-plan-branches-289276872.html] says:
{quote}
Plan branches are used to represent a branch in your version control repository, with the plan branch using the same build configuration as your plan.
{quote}
#* This implies that you can use a different branch when creating a branch plan, but this currently can only be accomplished when overriding the repository settings.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the documentation to make it clear that not overriding the repository settings will cause the branch plan to not use it's own branch, but the branch configured in the main plan.

h3. Notes

This is for this version of Bamboo: 5.10-OD-15-001 (and some previous versions).
fields.summary: Improve documentation regarding repositories

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Bamboo run builds without checking users' _build_ permission when:
** _Anonymous users_ permission has been disabled AND;
** _Logged in users_ have only _View_ permission AND;
** _user_ does not have build permission to the plan

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a group in Bamboo (_e.g.: bamboo-user_)
# create a user in Bamboo (_e.g.: userA_) and add the same to _bamboo-user_ group
{code:sql}
/* get user/group */
select users.name, groups.groupname
  from users
  join local_members on local_members.userid = users.id
  join groups on groups.id = local_members.groupid
{code}
||name||groupname||
|admin|bamboo-admin|
|userA|bamboo-user|
{code:sql}
/* global permission */
select AE.TYPE as TYPE,
       AE.SID as ENTITY,
       AE.MASK as PERMISSION_TYPE
  from ACL_ENTRY as AE
  join ACL_OBJECT_IDENTITY as AOI on AE.ACL_OBJECT_IDENTITY = AOI.ID
 where AOI.OBJECT_ID_CLASS = 'com.atlassian.bamboo.security.GlobalApplicationSecureObject'
   and AE.TYPE in ('PRINCIPAL','GROUP_PRINCIPAL')
   and AE.MASK = 16;
{code}
||TYPE||ENTITY||PERMISSION_TYPE||
|GROUP_PRINCIPAL|bamboo-admin|16|
# create a Project / Plan (_e.g.: PROJ-PLAN_)
# remove _Anonymous users_ permission from {{Plan configuration >> Permissions}}
!planPermission.png|thumbnail!
{code:sql}
/* plan permission */
select PROJECT.TITLE as PROJECT_TITLE,
       PLAN.TITLE as PLAN_TITLE,
       PLAN.FULL_KEY as PLAN_KEY,
       AE.SID as ENTITY,
       AE.MASK as PERMISSION_TYPE
  from ACL_ENTRY as AE
  join ACL_OBJECT_IDENTITY as AOI on AE.ACL_OBJECT_IDENTITY = AOI.ID
  join BUILD as PLAN on AOI.OBJECT_ID_IDENTITY = PLAN.build_id
  join PROJECT on PLAN.project_id = PROJECT.PROJECT_ID
 where AE.TYPE in ('PRINCIPAL','GROUP_PRINCIPAL')
   and AE.GRANTING = TRUE
   and PLAN.build_type = 'CHAIN'
   and PLAN.FULL_KEY = 'PROJ-PLAN'
 order by PLAN_KEY, ENTITY, PERMISSION_TYPE
{code}
||PROJECT_TITLE||PLAN_TITLE||PLAN_KEY||ENTITY||PERMISSION_TYPE||
|Project|Plan|PROJ-PLAN|admin|1|
|Project|Plan|PROJ-PLAN|admin|2|
|Project|Plan|PROJ-PLAN|admin|16|
|Project|Plan|PROJ-PLAN|admin|64|
|Project|Plan|PROJ-PLAN|admin|128|
# add _Subversion_ repository to {{Plan configuration >> Repositories}}
# add _Remote trigger_ to {{Plan configuration >> Triggers}} 
{code:sql}
/* get plan configuration */
select xml_definition_data
  from build_definition
  join build on build.build_id = build_definition.build_id
 where build.full_key = 'PROJ-PLAN'
{code}
{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create source that would trigger a compiler error. For example main.c:
{noformat}
#include <stdio.h>
void main(void)
{
  printf("Hello world!")
}
{noformat}
# Use a compiler that produces colourized output in a build script (for example use the wrapper colorgcc for gcc)
{noformat}
colorgcc -o hello main.c
{noformat}
# Run a build 
# Open the build log 
# Click on the View link

h3. Expected Results
If ANSI colour codes are present then the ANSI colour codes are interpreted and the text is coloured

h3. Actual Results
The build log is displayed as raw data.

h3. From BAM-20384
It would be nice to support full RGB palette. It may help to read complex execution logs.
ANSI color support was implemented in BAM-10855.

Convertion details described in hterm terminal documentation:
[https://chromium.googlesource.com/apps/libapps/+/HEAD/hterm/doc/ControlSequences.md#SGR-extended-color]
fields.summary: ANSI color codes are not interpreted in build output

fields.description:
Hi guys,

It looks like there may be an issue with Bamboo Remote Agents merging the variables of system and user-level PATH environment variables, which is only currently verified for Windows machines. Only the user-level value is currently being used by the Remote Agent, even if both variables do exist.

This may affect instances that depend on user-level override values, and would cause problems.
fields.summary: Bamboo Remote Agents not merging variables properly in Windows

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the configuration of repositories in branch plans can be one of the following:
# Override the plan's default repository
# Use the plan's default

Option 1 allows us to actually select a different branch for the branch plan from the plan's default, but it creates a new separate repository setting, which cannot be a Linked Repository setting. 

If we, for example, change the password or the user, we must change the configuration of the plan's default and all branches that override the configuration.

In option 2, we cannot select a branch and the same branch is used in all cases, preventing the branch plan from running code in different branches.

h3. Suggested Solution

I suggest:
# Allow branch plans to connect to Linked Repositories
# Allow a different branch from the one configured in the Linked Repository to be selected (requested [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-16101])

This way, we can use the same configuration, by overriding, but still only need to manage one.
fields.summary: Allow branch plans to use Linked Repositories

fields.description:
As mentioned in discussion around BAM-15449 it is currently possible for commits to Bitbucket Server repositories to go unbuilt, due to concurrency settings on the plan.  The scenario is:

* Bitbucket Server sends an event to Bamboo
* Bamboo receives the event
* Bamboo starts to queue a build but 
* Bamboo's plan concurrency check notes that the build is already running, and stops queuing the new build.

This can be worked around by increasing the plan concurrency setting.
fields.summary: Commits to Bitbucket Server repositories should not be lost due to build concurrency limits

Both links result in 403 Forbidden pages. This is preventing me from configuring Active Directory.

* [Mapping Active Directory](https://confluence.atlassian.com/dev/confluence-ldap-documentation-index/mapping-active-directory-to-confluence)

fields.description: Please add the ability to add text formatting (bold, italic, strikethrought, etc.) to a linked JIRA issue key based on the status of the key. For example closed tickets that have been built against for whatever reason could display a strikethrough. Escalated or higher priority issues could be bolded or the like. It would be nice if these things were configurable by the end user.
fields.summary: Allow Bamboo to change text format of related builds based on JIRA issue status

fields.description:
Greetings Atlassian Bamboo,

I'm writing to request that on the Build result summary, under Code Commits, that there be an added Range of Builds option. This would enable the user to see all of the Code Commits aka Fixes from the current build to say 4 builds ago for example.

More specifically, as a QA worker, say I wanted to review the Code Commits from  one build after the previous build I tested to the current build. Then an example would be: On Tuesday I tested build 764. On Wednesday I came in and saw that the recent build is 771. So now I would like to review the Fixes that occurred from 765 - 771 all on one page. This saves the headache & time of having to click through each build.

Feel free to contact me if the above is not clear enough or you have some questions on the matter.

Cheers
fields.summary: View fixes for a Range of Builds on Build Summary Tab

fields.description:
If you have a script task that requires contents out of /home/bamboo, it is common place in shell scripting to reference a file using the following notation: {{~/file.txt}}.

However, since the environment isn't set up correctly, using this notation breaks the scripts.  The environment is set incorrectly because the script runs as the {{bamboo}} user, but the environment variables supplied to the script reference the {{root}} user.

In the example above, the {{HOME}} environment variable says {{/root}} instead of referencing {{/home/bamboo}}.  This breaks any references to applications that depend on {{~/}} shell script notation.

With respect to invalid variables, it also incorrectly sets the {{MAIL}} and {{LOGNAME}} environment variables.

I have not checked to determine if any other environment variables are set incorrectly.

To duplicate this, you can create a simple plan, then add a script task containing the following: {{env | sort}}.
fields.summary: Bamboo user runs script tasks with improper environment on Linux

fields.description:

However, I'd like to have the ability to inject variables into child/dependency plans.
fields.summary: Add ability to inject variables between parent and child (dependent) plans

h3. Summary

* Apache DS 2.0.0-M21

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Bamboo and define a local administrator user (for example bamboo)
# Configure Bamboo for LDAP integration
# Login as the local administrator
# Open the User Repositories screen
# Select the Local Users and Groups option and save
# Logout and login as the local administrator

fields.description: Looking at https://developer.atlassian.com/bamboodev/rest-apis/bamboo-rest-resources , there are no REST API for deployment creation. There should also be one for deployment plan creation. This will be a nice addition to users who wants to create the plans programmatically than manually via the UI.
fields.summary: REST API to create deployment plans in Bamboo

fields.description:
Users with WRITE permission to a Bamboo plan can't currently test connection to plan-local repositories. WRITE permission to a plan is sufficient to edit that plan repositories' configuration, and thus should be sufficient to test connection.

Steps to reproduce:
ADMIN:
- create plan
- create plan-local repository
- edit repository configuration: success
- test connection to that repository: success
- create user
- grant user WRITE to that plan

USER:
- edit plan
- edit repository configuration: success (WRITE was sufficient to save changes)
- test connection to that repository - ERROR
fields.summary: Test connection - incorrect permission checking for plan-local repositories

fields.description:
A job can have an Artifact Dependency on an artifact created in an earlier stage.

If the job in the earlier stage is disabled, the artifact won't be created, and the later stage will fail as it has a dependency on the artifact.
To have the stage skip the artifact dependency, your only option is to delete it.
It would be useful if you can disable/enable the dependency.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to disable Artifact Dependencies

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Right now most of the Bamboo log is present in the catalina.out since it seems to log the whole content from atlassian-bamboo.log plus the Tomcat logs. The atlassian-bamboo.log also logs the content from the access_log.<date> but in this case a bit trimmed. In other words, we have multiple files with repeated information consuming space and also cluttering the specific log content.
h3. Suggested Solution
 * The catalina.out should hold Tomcat specific logs (the default log4j configuration should be adjusted for this)
 * The atlassian-bamboo.log should hold only the product log (without the access logs, since they are present in a different file)

h3. Workaround for catalina.out logging

The Log4j.properties can be configured to show only the relevant bamboo information in catalina.out
fields.summary: Reduce the overlap in bamboo log files

fields.description:
Error:
Could not execute task 'Inject variables' no Plugin with key 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.bamboo-variable-inject-plugin:inject' is installed. 

On Bamboo - server 5.10.02
Some bamboo plans which include task 'Inject variables' give the error from above. Those bamboo plans, are run on remote agents with Windows-server 2012.
fields.summary: Could not execute task 'Inject variables'

fields.description:
When fetching job result via REST: {noformat}/rest/api/latest/result/<projectKey>-<planKey>-<jobKey>-<resultNumber>{noformat} if we're not expanding log entries , Bamboo appears to still *parse* the job result's log just to count the number of lines.

This might be improved by avoiding to do the parsing unless the logs are actually needed. To get the number of log entries, just counting number of lines in log file would be enough. Alternatively, the calls might not return any information related to logs until the expansion query parameter is actually added.

Log parsing include e.g. parsing date for every log line. If the log is large, it affects the REST call time a lot.
fields.summary: Improve counting log lines when fetching job result via REST

fields.description:
Hi,
We are using "deployment environment permissions" to restrict deployment in prod and uat env. But one issue with this is, users are creating "new release builds from build result" and deploying to prod / uat env. *This is a problem for us, as untested code being deployed in prod / uat env*. We are using bamboo.buildnumber as versioning scheme.
How can we restrict users creating "new release builds from build result"
Let's say we have PROD / UAT env and we don't want users assigned to PROD / UAT env to create new release jobs and they should be deploying build only from the previous released env.
We need option in bamboo to define the promotion process. let's say we always wanted to deploy builds from
Dev -> QA -> UAT -> PROD
in each env, the users should see the previous deployed build and not all the builds.
Please let me know if you have more questions / suggestions to solve this problem. We are finding this as a big problem with our CI / CD setup.
Thanks,
Subbu
fields.summary: restricting permission to create release from build result

fields.description:
*Overview*
I have a directory of files as an artifact in Bamboo. 
A distinction is being made on whether there is a file named index.htm or index.html.  I believe that these files should be treated the same, regardless of extension (this seems to be a generally accepted convention).
The attached document shows the differences observed; basically, the 'index.htm' will automatically be selected if it exists; but the 'index.html' file will not.

*Background:*
As a part of Bamboo build, a directory of files is persisted as an artifact.
The name of one of the files is ‘index.html’
*Action:*
Select the link for the Artifact ‘Nunit Reports’
*Result:*
Selecting the link of the Artifact yields a list of the files in the artifact.
*Expected Result:*
Selecting the link of the Artifact yields the results of the ‘index.html’ being selected.
fields.summary: Bamboo Artifact link should behave same for index.htm or index.html

fields.description: I would like to include certain builds and certain deployments on a single dashboard.
fields.summary: dashboards for bamboo

fields.description:
*Scenario:*
Today, any user on Bamboo can generate the Author's Report and see all the authors available. I'd like to be able to restrict access to that list, so users that only have access to a certain plan, also have limited access to authors that have contributed to that specific plan instead of the entire bamboo list of authors.

*Problem:*
- The missing permissions for Author's Report (Report upper menu > Authors) 

*Expected Results:*
- I'd like to restrict the view of authors available.

*Actual Results:*
- Today, anyone can see a full list of authors that have contributed at any project.
fields.summary: Restrict Author's Report based on plan permission

fields.description: I'd like to be able to use docker-compose to start containers on a remote host, as either part of a CI build or as a deployment build.
fields.summary: Support for docker-compose for deployment projects

fields.description: Causes notifications for responsible users not being set on job state change.
fields.summary: Delta state not set on job results

fields.description:
Some customers may use very long names in their repositories. 

A good improvement for Bamboo would be to expand the repository selection field out to accommodate these, or to possiblly a way to trim down the common parts of the names to focus on the unique elements.
fields.summary: Very long repository names not displayed completely.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attempting to add a user to the application in the internal user directory is impossible (the form is invisible) if the option "Read-only external user management?" is selected under Administration > Security settings.

The options clearly indicates:
{quote}Enable this option if you are connecting Bamboo to an external user management system and do not have update rights there.{quote}

h3. Environment
* Windows


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Bamboo
# Navigate to Administration > Security settings
# Select the "Edit" button
# Select the option to "Read-only external user management?"
# Select the "Save" button
# Navigate to Administration > Users

h3. Expected Results
The form to "Add user" is visible.
!form_visible.PNG|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The form is invisible:
!form_invisible.PNG|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
Disable this option.
fields.summary: "Add user" form disappears when "Read-only external user management?" option is selected

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sometimes Bamboo doesn't shut down correctly and its process keeps hanging around, even though the application itself is not accessible anymore.

h3. Environment

This was observed on a unix-based operating system.

h3. Expected Results

Bamboo shuts down correctly (no process hanging around) and the following can be observed inside the {{<bamboo-installation-directory>/logs/catalina.out}} file:

{code}
2016-03-16 12:08:46,542 INFO [LastResortTerminationThread] [lifecycle] *******************************
2016-03-16 12:08:46,542 INFO [LastResortTerminationThread] [lifecycle] *  Bamboo has been shut down  *
2016-03-16 12:08:46,542 INFO [LastResortTerminationThread] [lifecycle] *******************************
2016-03-16 12:08:46,542 WARN [LastResortTerminationThread] [ShutdownEnforcer] Calling System.exit()
{code}

h3. Actual Results

The following stack trace appears inside the {{<bamboo-installation-directory>/logs/catalina.out}} file:

{code}
16-Mar-2016 11:29:54.152 INFO [EventSubscriptionCapabilities:thread-1] org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoaderBase.checkStateForResourceLoading Illegal access: this web application instance has been stopped already. Could not load [sun.reflect.MethodAccessorImpl]. The following stack trace is thrown for debugging purposes as well as to attempt to terminate the thread which caused the illegal access.
 java.lang.IllegalStateException: Illegal access: this web application instance has been stopped already. Could not load [sun.reflect.MethodAccessorImpl]. The following stack trace is thrown for debugging purposes as well as to attempt to terminate the thread which caused the illegal access.
	at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoaderBase.checkStateForResourceLoading(WebappClassLoaderBase.java:1335)
	at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoaderBase.checkStateForClassLoading(WebappClassLoaderBase.java:1321)
	at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoaderBase.loadClass(WebappClassLoaderBase.java:1203)
	at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoaderBase.loadClass(WebappClassLoaderBase.java:1164)
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.findClassOrResourceByDelegation(BundleWiringImpl.java:1460)
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.access$400(BundleWiringImpl.java:75)
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl$BundleClassLoader.loadClass(BundleWiringImpl.java:1955)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:357)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.defineClass(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.ClassDefiner.defineClass(ClassDefiner.java:63)
	at sun.reflect.MethodAccessorGenerator$1.run(MethodAccessorGenerator.java:399)
	at sun.reflect.MethodAccessorGenerator$1.run(MethodAccessorGenerator.java:394)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.MethodAccessorGenerator.generate(MethodAccessorGenerator.java:393)
	at sun.reflect.MethodAccessorGenerator.generateMethod(MethodAccessorGenerator.java:75)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:53)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:317)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:56)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:60)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:133)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:121)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokeUnprivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:70)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:53)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.LocalBundleContextAdvice.invoke(LocalBundleContextAdvice.java:57)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:133)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:121)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:207)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy1040.capableOf(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.event.remote.impl.cache.CapabilitiesCacheLoader.getKeys(CapabilitiesCacheLoader.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.failurecache.ExpirationDateBasedCacheImpl.updateCacheKeys(ExpirationDateBasedCacheImpl.java:86)
	at com.atlassian.failurecache.ExpirationDateBasedCacheImpl.refresh(ExpirationDateBasedCacheImpl.java:78)
	at com.atlassian.event.remote.impl.cache.EventSubscriptionCapabilities.refresh(EventSubscriptionCapabilities.java:76)
	at com.atlassian.event.remote.impl.cache.EventSubscriptionCapabilities.run(EventSubscriptionCapabilities.java:84)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)

	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

If we try to restart Bamboo again, the application will fail to start with the following errors inside the {{<bamboo-home-directory>/logs/atlassian-bamboo.log}} file:

{code}
2016-03-16 11:50:27,562 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [SharedFileLocker] Database /Users/bruno/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.10.2/home/jms-store/bamboo/KahaDB/lock is locked... waiting 10 seconds for the database to be unlocked. Reason: java.io.IOException: File '/Users/bruno/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.10.2/home/jms-store/bamboo/KahaDB/lock' could not be locked.
{code}

This happens because then you'll have two Bamboo processes running at the same time. This can be observed when running a {{ps aux | grep}} command:

{code}
bruno$ ps aux | grep bamboo
bruno            1191   0.0  5.6  4757160 938888 s000  S    11:19AM   5:51.56 /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.8.0_71.jdk/Contents/Home/bin/java -Djava.util.logging.config.file=/Users/bruno/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.10.2/install/conf/logging.properties -Djava.util.logging.manager=org.apache.juli.ClassLoaderLogManager -Xms256m -Xmx384m -Djava.endorsed.dirs=/Users/bruno/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.10.2/install/endorsed -classpath /Users/bruno/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.10.2/install/bin/bootstrap.jar:/Users/bruno/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.10.2/install/bin/tomcat-juli.jar -Dcatalina.base=/Users/bruno/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.10.2/install -Dcatalina.home=/Users/bruno/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.10.2/install -Djava.io.tmpdir=/Users/bruno/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.10.2/install/temp org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap start
bruno            1633   0.0  0.0  2432772    660 s002  S+   12:02PM   0:00.00 grep bamboo
bruno            1553   0.0  4.1  4537820 694892 s002  S    11:49AM   2:03.93 /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.8.0_71.jdk/Contents/Home/bin/java -Djava.util.logging.config.file=/Users/bruno/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.10.2/install/conf/logging.properties -Djava.util.logging.manager=org.apache.juli.ClassLoaderLogManager -Xms256m -Xmx384m -Djava.endorsed.dirs=/Users/bruno/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.10.2/install/endorsed -classpath /Users/bruno/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.10.2/install/bin/bootstrap.jar:/Users/bruno/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.10.2/install/bin/tomcat-juli.jar -Dcatalina.base=/Users/bruno/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.10.2/install -Dcatalina.home=/Users/bruno/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.10.2/install -Djava.io.tmpdir=/Users/bruno/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.10.2/install/temp org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap start
{code}

Is there any way to improve the shut down process to ensure that it doesn't hang and prevent Bamboo from starting up again without having to issue a {{kill}} command?

h3.Workaround

Locate the Bamboo process with a {{ps aux | grep}} command and kill it using {{kill -9 <pid>}}.
fields.summary: Bamboo process doesn't shut down correctly (randomly)

fields.description:
When changing the target room for a hipchat build notification the displayed room name in the notification list doesn't change leading to the belief that it hasn't worked.

However if some *other* *unrelated* change is made (I tested adding a new notification but I imagine others would work too) then the display updates correctly and the new room name is displayed.
fields.summary: Changing hipchat notification room doesn't update display in UI properly.

fields.description:
Integrating Bamboo with LDAP
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/integrating-bamboo-with-ldap-289277210.html

Step 4 — Map LDAP Data Tree
To map the LDAP Data Tree:
1. To configure the mappings in atlassian-user.xml for either AD or LDAP, please see:
- Mapping Active Directory
- Mapping other LDAP servers

The "Mapping other LDAP servers" item links to 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/dev/confluence-ldap-documentation-index/how-to-map-ldap-users-and-groups-to-confluence-via-atlassian-user

For normal users this results in a 403.
Atlassian users see the page is flagged with a warning panel:
{panel}
This documentation is out of date
Please refer to the latest documentation on [Understanding User Management in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF35/Understanding+User+Management+in+Confluence] and [Connecting to an LDAP Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/connecting-to-an-ldap-directory-229838241.html].

fields.description:
*Current Behaviour*
Currently, users will need to enter their password when doing any SSH task. Whenever the user changed the password, user will need to manually update all SSH and SCP tasks in the build plans.

*Requested Behaviour*
Users are able to feed usernames and passwords from a variable to SSH task. If the password changes then only variable has to be updated.

*Proposed Solution*
Add a new authentication type "variable". Once selected you'll be presented a listbox with defined password variables.
fields.summary: Provide an option to select authentication type when SSH or SCP

fields.description: Filling group name with ampersand in its name in Plan permissions causes incorrect display of set permissions. Even if you give all permissions all checkboxes are unchecked (see picture). On the next save all permissions are taken away because of empty checkboxes.
fields.summary: Ampersand in group name causes incorrect permission display

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When enabling Bamboo notifications and using the *Change of Build Status* event, Bamboo doesn't notify when a merge conflict causes a build failure. 

h3. Duplication Steps
# Configure the Change of Build Status event 
# Integrate Bamboo with IM or mail server. 
# Configure automatic merging (Gatekeeper) 
# Trigger a passing build
# Trigger a build that where a merge conflict will occur

h3. Expected Result

Bamboo would assign a responsible user and trigger the Change of Build Status event when build failure occurs due to merge conflict

h3. Current Result

Build is failed but no notification is received even though status changes

h3. Workaround

None known at this time.
fields.summary: Change of Build Status event doesn't notify on merge conflict build failure

fields.description:
As a company IT administrator of our company
I want that all users authenticate to bamboo in two steps (username password  & app or sms).
So that I'm always sure that a employee of our company logs in bamboo instead of a hacker. This makes even my infrastructure more secure.
fields.summary: Two factor Authentication

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Before 5.10.1.1 a user could quarantine a failing test with just the plan level "admin" permissions. Now a user is required to have both "build" and "admin" permissions. Tested in 5.10.1.1 and 5.10.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Remove the plan level "build" permission from a user that also plan level "admin" permission
# Attempt to quarantine a test

h3. Expected Results
The test gets quarantined

h3. Actual Results
The logs register a post at the proper URL, nothing in the UI changes, and the test is not quarantined

h3.Workaround
No workarounds discovered at this time
fields.summary: Test quarantine now tied to both admin and build permissoins

fields.description: Currently the latest available Rest API endpoints only allow for collecting of VCS information on the default repo of a branch/plan and only when provided with branch/plan info. It would be nice if there was a more universal endpoint to grab various VCS data. This could include all active repos/branches with flags to sort by plans, projects, VCS type, etc. It would be awesome if this could include latest commit data as well.
fields.summary: REST endpoint to get ALL VCS data

fields.description:
Greetings! There are issues centered around the old way of doing authentication for bamboo (as well as fisheye/crucible) in that it uses a single auth link instead of being able to add multiple directories (including local) similar to how jira, confluence, and bitbucket function. 

One of the biggest issues is the lack of a local authentication directory. If the singular authentication directory goes down for whatever reason, it is impossible to login using a local account without changing XML and restarting bamboo, which is inconvenient and undesirable.  Also, when using mixed directories of incremental and full sync (normal connector vs "delegated" connector), they default to full sync when merged into a single crowd application link. Lastly, with multiple authentication sources we can run multiple crowd servers for redundancy.

Please investigate the modernization of the authentication system,  to make it more in line with the other apps. Uniformity really does count for something.
fields.summary: Modern Authentication Uniformity

fields.description: When a remote/local/elastic agent finishes to build a job, Bamboo has to process its results, so the agent sends the information back to the Bamboo server for processing. Currently there's a max of 1 build result being processed at a time, and if this thread hangs, everything else will hang. This is a database heavy operation so Bamboo only processes one build result at a time, and one should be enough unless the queue gets blocked for some other reason (e.g. if you're executing a post-build script that takes a long time). If you're holding this thread with a post-build script and another job finish, Bamboo will not be able to move on to process the next build result. So it will end up blocking the entire server processing queue and builds will start hanging. It would be nice if we could somehow increase the number of threads that can process build results in Bamboo.
fields.summary: Bamboo should be able to process more than one build result at a time

fields.description:
*The case:*

I have the heavy build that triggered by parent plans. I want to limit the build frequency e.g. one in hour (not each hour, but only if parent plan was build),

*Proposed solution:*
Add to a project dependency management section some control that will somehow manage that.
fields.summary: Deffer build triggered by parent plan build

fields.description:
Raising this improvement ticket based on a suggestion raised by a customer.

{quote}
AWS API calls need to be authenticated with a key ID and Secret. These are the ones requested by Bamboo Elastic Instances configuration, in order to spin up EC2 instances on customer’s accounts.

The thing is, right now, only user keys, that are static are supported. There’s another method called “Assume Role”, in which every API call is made with a different, disposable key-secret pair. This is the method recommended by AWS, since it’s way more secure and easy to manage.

Other products that require AWS credentials from customer’s accounts already use this method with great success, such as Datadog and Sumologic.

The main point here is: this does not require major changes on your side, only to the authentication part.

More information can be found here:

* https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/aws/delegating-api-access-to-aws-services-using-iam-roles/
* http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/walkthru_cross-account-with-roles.html
* http://docs.aws.amazon.com/STS/latest/APIReference/API_AssumeRole.html
* http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_temp.html
{quote}

It would be useful if the IAM Role could be specified when [Configuring Elastic Bamboo|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/configuring-elastic-bamboo-289277120.html].
fields.summary: Using 'Assume Role' for AWS API calls instead of traditional authentication key ID and secret key

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Inside the _Artifact download_ task, when the list of Source plans is long, only a few plans are listed (currently 10), so the user has to enter a few letters in order to filter (auto-fill) the list further. However it's not possible to select an option from the drop-down select list using the mouse, only by using the keyboard.
h3. Environment
 # This issue is observed in the following web browsers: Google Chrome, Internet Explorer and Safari.
 # The issue does NOT seem to happen in Mozilla Firefox.
 # It is reproduced across multiple operating systems.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create/access the [Artifact download|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Sharing+artifacts] task inside a plan.
 # Start typing to fill in the *Source plan* field and search for a plan.
 # The drop-down list will appear with the search results.
 # Click/select one of the plans using the mouse.

h3. Expected Results

The plan is selected.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens. It is as if you did NOT click the plan.
h3. Workaround

It is necessary to use the keyboard to navigate in the drop-down list and select the plan.
fields.summary: Cannot select Source plan from drop down list in Artifact Download task

fields.description:
_As a Bamboo administrator, I need to be able to automate the setup process for Bamboo so that I can manage/provision our instances with build scripts/configuration management tools._

Bitbucket Server currently provides [an ideal model|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/automated-setup-for-bitbucket-server-776640098.html] for how this should work. Through a single properties file, an administrator can provide the necessary JDBC connection, system admin, and licensing info, and take a fresh server to a fully provisioned instance without having to touch a single setup screen.

Bamboo already provides the ability to import properties in order to set the Bamboo home directory through {{INSTALL_PATH/atlassian-bamboo/WEB-INF/classes/bamboo-init.properties}}, and so ideally we should be able to source the same file for the necessary setup information (JDBC, system admin, and licensing.)
fields.summary: Externalize setup properties for automated setup
Add support to use variables for Docker repository

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
xUnit.net test results cannot be parsed natively within Bamboo Test results must be converted to a different format first, which may conflict with a project's internal requirements / standards for testing and reporting

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a new build task type of xUnit.net Parser to parse xUnit.net results

h3. Workaround
xUnit.net test results must currently be exported in NUnit format and parsed using the NUnit Parser task instead.

Regards,

Dave Chevell
fields.summary: Add native support for parsing xUnit.net test results
Running git show-ref throws an exception if branch does not exist locally

fields.description: Instead of queuing individual jobs, queue the whole plan. So if you start multiple plans on the same agent, a whole plan is completed before the next plan starts. Right now, if two plans are started one after the other, the order for building will be something like Plan1-Job1 => Plan2-Job1 => Plan1-Job2 => Plan2-Job2. Ideally, there would be an option to make it be Plan1-Job1 => Plan1-Job2 => Plan2-Job1 => Plan2-Job2.
fields.summary: Queue a plan instead of a job

fields.description:
We pulled down the latest atlasassian-plugin-sdk 6.2.4 to build a new task plugin for bamboo and discovered it would load but not enable on a remote agent.

we put out a question here: [bamboo-plugin-not-found-on-agents|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/37534625/bamboo-plugin-not-found-on-agents] 

building the packaged helloworld example with no changes does not work on a remote agent. It works find on the atlas-run local agent with the local server.

This caused us quite a bit of grief. We were able to remove the unit test code from the plugin to get it working, but it seems that the out of the box example should work on local and remote agents.
fields.summary: bamboo plugin helloworld does not run from a remote agent

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Artifact download task breaks when plan is moved.  This only affects Artifact Download tasks if they are in the same plan, example, Job A in Stage B downloading artifact from Job A Stage A.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a plan with 2 stages with a job in each stage
# Create an artifact definition in the first stage job
# Create a artifact download task in the second stage job. Set it to point to the first stage
# Move the plan to another project

h3. Expected Results
The source plan of the artifact download task should be updated to point to the new Job key
h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:
{noformat}
2016-03-09 21:18:21,763 ERROR [AtlassianEvent::0-BAM::EVENTS:pool-2-thread-7] [AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher] There was an exception thrown trying to dispatch event [com.atlassian.bamboo.event.BuildFinishedEvent[source=com.atlassian.bamboo.build.DefaultBuildExecutionManager@44c46304] job=PROJ2-PLAN1-JOB1 #2] from the invoker [SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker{method=public void com.atlassian.bamboo.chains.ChainExecutionManagerImpl.onBuildFinished(com.atlassian.bamboo.event.BuildFinishedEvent), listener=com.atlassian.bamboo.chains.ChainExecutionManagerImpl@7e9032a0}]
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to find plan [PROJ-PLAN1]
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher$1$1.run(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:46)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.utils.BambooRunnables$1.run(BambooRunnables.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.security.ImpersonationHelper.runWith(ImpersonationHelper.java:31)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.security.ImpersonationHelper.runWithSystemAuthority(ImpersonationHelper.java:20)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.security.ImpersonationHelper$1.run(ImpersonationHelper.java:52)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to find plan [PROJ-PLAN1]
{noformat}

In the task configuration, the source plan is still pointing to the old JOB key.

h3.Workaround
Manually update the artifact download task to select the proper source job
fields.summary: Artifact download task breaks when plan is moved

fields.description:
The *build queue timeout* feature, inside the [Build Monitoring|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Configuring+the+build+queue+timeout+event] page, is an event thrown when a build has been waiting in the build queue for longer than a specified period of time, it is meant to notify users that a build is queued longer than it should, but it does not remove the build from the queue.

It would be nice if this feature could be enhanced in such a way that the user could opt to not only be notified about a build that's been waiting in the queue longer than it should but also *remove* the build from queue if the build queue time is exceeded.
fields.summary: Improve build queue timeout feature to actually remove build from the queue

fields.description:
I'd like to see a feature that lets us know through a log file (and perhaps other configurable ways) that a child plan was triggered, or not triggered.

In the case of not being triggered, explain why.

For example:
Setup 'planA' with a dependency to 'planB'.
planA has 3 branches: master (default), foo, and bar.
planB only has 1 branch: master (default)

The 'foo' branch in planA is triggered.
Even though planA is configured to trigger child planB when it completes successfully, it won't because planB doesn't have the same branch.

Of course, this is documented, but the interface doesn't lend itself to understanding the chain of events if a problem occurs.  This leads to difficult to diagnose situations that is more guess work than definitive logging output.

I'd like to see an option that allows us to get better information about these chains of plans.
fields.summary: Add more logging information to a parent plan when a child plan does/doesn't execute.

fields.description: Currently Bamboo does not allow for the automatic branch merging of Perforce type repositories as with other SCMs.
fields.summary: Automatic merging for Perforce

fields.description: If a build fails on a certain branch and is later fixed, that branch is still marked as failed in my pull request on Bitbucket Cloud. According to the Bitbucket Cloud team in [this ticket|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/12356/if-latest-test-passed-but-recent-test] it's because the previous build status has to be updated in their API, as opposed to a new one being created.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Cloud status not updated correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When rebuilding a failed build, Bamboo will miscalculate the duration in certain cases. Namely the build status in a linked Bitbucket Server instance is misreported.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up Bitbucket Server and Bamboo link
# Make a build fail
# Check build status in Bitbucket 
# Rebuild some time later (and make the build pass) 
# The build time is misreported

h3. Expected Results

The build duration is the same as shown in the Bamboo build result summary page.

h3. Actual Results

The build duration is _not_ the same as shown in the Bamboo build result summary page.
fields.summary: Rebuild causes incorrect duration to get reported in Bitbucket

fields.description:
When installing Bamboo with MySQL the table TRUSTED_KEY is not created. h3. Environment * OSX 10.11.1 * MySQL 5.6.25 * Bamboo 5.10.1.1 and 5.10.2 h3. Steps to Reproduce # Follow the instructions to install Bamboo with MySQL as per: [Connecting Bamboo to an external database - MySQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/mysql-289276817.html] # After the last wizard step when the tables are created this error is thrown in the logs. h3. Expected Results # The table TRUSTED_KEY is created without errors. h3. Actual Results The following error is thrown in catalina.out: {noformat} 2016-03-03 14:13:09,880 ERROR [performSetupDatabaseConnectionBackgroundThread] [SchemaExport] Unsuccessful: create table TRUSTED_KEY (id bigint not null, HOST varchar(255) not null, SSH_KEY varchar(4000) not null, APPROVED bit not null, primary key (id), unique (HOST, SSH_KEY)) {noformat} If you are importing a file into one of these releases of Bamboo you will get: {noformat} Import failed. Please contact Atlassian at https://support.atlassian.com/ and attach your export file.
java.lang.RuntimeException: [Table 'bamboo.TRUSTED_KEY' doesn't exist] at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.XmlMigrator.setNextHiValue(XmlMigrator.java:251) at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.XmlMigrator.importXml(XmlMigrator.java:217) at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.XmlMigrator$$FastClassBySpringCGLIB$$b6578fc7.invoke() at org.springframework.cglib.proxy.MethodProxy.invoke(MethodProxy.java:204) at org.springframework.aop.framework.CglibAopProxy$CglibMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(CglibAopProxy.java:708) at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:157) at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor$1.proceedWithInvocation(TransactionInterceptor.java:98) {noformat} h3. Notes This table is correctly created when Bamboo is connected to Postgres. The Bamboo installation is completed without UI errors but other problems may occur. This was first noticed when trying to import a Bamboo backup that was running on PostgreSQL since the table exists there, but was not created when installing Bamboo using MySQL, so it failed to import the data from that table into the new Bamboo instance. h3. Workaround Install Bamboo 5.10.1.1 and then upgrade to 5.10.2 {panel} (i) *Important* During 5.10.2 installation there will be warning that index can't be created, it doesn't affect installation nor functionality {panel}
fields.summary: When installing Bamboo with MySQL the table TRUSTED_KEY is not created

fields.description:
This page 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/script-289277046.html
indicates that script tasks use Bash on Linux, when in reality they use /bin/sh. See related bug:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-10320

Please fix the documentation to be correct, as this has an impact on how scripts are written.
fields.summary: Documentation incorrect about bash vs sh in scripts

fields.description:
h3. Reproducing issue:
# create a new Project (i.e.: Support), Plan (i.e.: MyPlan)
# add an "{{Script}}" task
{code}
# creates a new file
touch executable.jar

# list files
ls -l

# change its permission
chmod 755 executable.jar

# list files
ls -l
{code}
As a result you would have something like:
{noformat}
12-Dec-2014 14:08:52	total 0
12-Dec-2014 14:08:52	-rw-r--r--  1 root  root  0 Dec 12 14:08 executable.jar
12-Dec-2014 14:08:52	total 0
12-Dec-2014 14:08:52	-rwxr-xr-x  1 root  root  0 Dec 12 14:08 executable.jar
{noformat}
# create an Artifact definition as per following:
{noformat}
Name: myArtifact
Location:
Copy pattern: executable.jar
[x] Shared
{noformat}
# go to "{{<bamboo-home>/artifacts}}" and run the following:
{code}
ls -l SUP-MYPLAN/shared/build-00001/myArtifact/executable.jar
{code}
As a result you would have something like:
{noformat}
-rw-r--r--  1 root  root  0 Dec 12 14:08 SUP-MYPLAN/shared/build-00001/myArtifact/executable.jar
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
- Write a script job that will re-set the correct permissions
- Tar everything up before creating the artifacts and then pass around a tarball rather than just pure artifacts.
fields.summary: Artifact permissions are not preserved for local agents and agents using other handlers (including S3)

I commented the original bug, opened a support ticket and it is still "Resolved".
fields.summary: Artifact permissions are not preserved - Regression

fields.description:
You can't use a Docker Task on a Windows Bamboo server, as on Windows you can't run a Docker command straight from the commandline.
You have to run it from inside the VM started by Boot2Docker or Docker Machine.

Right now, users configure a Docker Capability, run a Docker Task, and it fails.
The documentation should point out that this will not work on Windows.

Pages affected:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Configuring+the+Docker+task+in+Bamboo
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Defining+a+new+Docker+capability
fields.summary: Documentation should point out that Docker Task can't run on Windows

fields.description:
I have recently had builds queued for 2.5 hours or more, because they require SQL Server or Oracle, and there are no agents available. The Bamboo instance won't spin up an elastic agent that provides these requirements because it's already at its elastic agent limit. Idle elastic agents hang around for up to an hour, which means it can take a long time to get a suitable elastic agent spun up. In some cases, there have not been any agents that can build the job at all, in others there has been one agent but it's busy building other builds. 

These builds often have 5 stages that take 1.5 hours each, so with one agent, the build can take over 7 hours. If you have 2 builds which require that same agent, obviously you wait a very long time.

It would be great if we could do some analysis of which builds need more agents, possibly to try to normalise the time-to-completion, eg if a build has only one agent but multiple stages and is going to take over one hour to complete, terminate some idle agents and spin up some more of the one that build requires.
fields.summary: Auto kill idle elastic agents when there are builds queued that can not be built on any existing agents

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When enabling SSL connectivity for remote agents by changing the Broker URL and Broker Client URL protocols from *tcp://* to *ssl://*, elastic agents are no longer able to connect  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start an Elastic Agent and run a test build to confirm Elastic Agents are connecting
# Stop the Elastic Agent
# Change the Broker URL and Broker Client URL, replacing "tcp://" with "ssl://" as per [Securing your remote agents|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Securing+your+remote+agents].
# Start the Elastic Agent again

h3. Expected Results
Elastic agent connectivity should continue working after enabling SSL for remote agents


h3. Actual Results
Elastic Agents never successfully connect to Bamboo but instead sit in "Pending" forever

h3.Workaround
[Securing your remote agents|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Securing+your+remote+agents] cannot be used in conjunction with Elastic Agents
fields.summary: Enabling SSL Broker for Remote Agents breaks Elastic Agent connectivity
Limit deployment plans from being executed during a timeframe
